Class SimpleJavaApplicationSchema

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.runtime.AbstractApplicationSchema<A,S>
      com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.AbstractJavaApplicationSchema<SimpleJavaApplication,SimpleJavaApplicationSchema>

All Implemented Interfaces:
ApplicationSchema<SimpleJavaApplication,SimpleJavaApplicationSchema>, JavaApplicationSchema<SimpleJavaApplication,SimpleJavaApplicationSchema>
public class SimpleJavaApplicationSchema
extends AbstractJavaApplicationSchema<SimpleJavaApplication,SimpleJavaApplicationSchema>
implements JavaApplicationSchema<SimpleJavaApplication,SimpleJavaApplicationSchema>

A SimpleJavaApplicationSchema is a JavaApplicationSchema for simple SimpleJavaApplications.

Method Detail

createJavaApplication

public SimpleJavaApplication createJavaApplication(Process process,
                                                   String name,
                                                   ApplicationConsole console,
                                                   Properties environmentVariables,
                                                   Properties systemProperties)
Instantiates a JavaApplication to represent the specified Java Process and properties. It's through this JavaApplication that developers will interact with the underlying Java Process.

Specified by:
createJavaApplication in interface JavaApplicationSchema<SimpleJavaApplication,SimpleJavaApplicationSchema>
Parameters:
process - the Process representing the JavaApplication
name - the name of the JavaApplication
console - the ApplicationConsole that will be used for I/O by the realized Application. This may be null if not required
environmentVariables - the environment variables used when starting the JavaApplication
systemProperties - the system properties provided to the JavaApplication
Returns:
a JavaApplication
